website_summaries.verdict: This entry-level prosumer camcorder is just one step below the top of the list in this topic.
pros: Vibrant high-definition images and excellent low-light performance

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing no wifi
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased Canon support said the camera was wi fi As much as it cost and being this new It should have been wi-fi The Canon rep I spoke to was surprised that it wasn't Canon greed tried to save a few $$ so the excluded wi fi so I returned it
customer_reviews.author: WisconsinPat

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went for G60
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning all the settings and have not gone manual yet, but the video quality is outstanding and the camera is generally easy to use. I did a project with external mic and boom, and sound quality was great. I like the dual slots - use one for video and one for photos. Very happy with it - worth it to go up from G50 for the larger sensor if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Walling

customer_reviews.title: Badly needs a software update
customer_reviews.text: They really need to update the software. You can start a time lapse on an iphone for instance in less than 3 seconds - on this you've got to go into the menu and set up the configuration to do it - there is no one button set up time lapse - you'd really have to ask if they know what people are doing on their cameras. There is everything you'd expect - great picture quality etc - but if you want to take great quality video using intuitive software go with a smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: We first tried a cheaper camera about 15% of the price. While it kind of worked, it would break up the videos into 30 minute sizes which made more work to compile and distribute. This Camera doesn't do that. The image looks great, needing almost no processing. A little trim at the ends potentially depending on how started and stopped. We use a tripod and a patch cord for the audio in to reduce noise of our chapel and get primarily the speakers during the service.
customer_reviews.author: D. Polister

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this camera. I have been waiting years for a consumer level camera that does 4K@60fps. After spending a week shooting and editing, I find that the image quality is just not there. As another reviewer pointed out, it is very soft and lacks the sharpness of other 4K cameras. Compared footage from my Sony AX100 which I owned for 3 years, the difference is night and day. Sony is sharp as a tack. The low light performance is terrible. Image is fuzzy and grainy. Sorry, I tried really hard to like it. i have included raw screen captures from playback. It helps to illustrate my issues.
customer_reviews.author: tlod0813

customer_reviews.title: Zoom frozen after second use
customer_reviews.text: The Camera worked great for our night of use, the second night the camera would not zoom. After reading some reviews, it seems that multiple people have issues with the zoom button going bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew S.

customer_reviews.title: Read the manual!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is I'm very pleased with all the operation and the quality of the video and the photos.
customer_reviews.author: william Letson

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: bought this camera for the online church services due to Coronavirus lockdown and it works perfectly. Great image and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo52

customer_reviews.title: Not as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I own the Canon VIXIA HF G40 and thought I should upgrade, this is a downgrade from the previous model as far as all quality aspects go. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: NasMas Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Quality Plus
customer_reviews.text: My son recommended this camera for our church to use for live streaming. It has absolutely every feature we need for state of the art live streaming. AND it is literally plug and play. We will be using this camera for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: MARK MIKELS

customer_reviews.title: Great for Live Stream
customer_reviews.text: We use the camera for live stream and those watching all say the picture quality has vastly improved
customer_reviews.author: Leslye M Schneier

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Camcorder Records internally UHD 4K 60 fps to dual ...
customer_reviews.text: Magnificent Camcorder Records internally UHD 4K 60 fps to dual SD cards, fast and accurate Dual Pixel Autofocus, 15x optical zoom in UHD 4K, 2 Processors (the same Processors used in Canon EOS C300 Mark II), 5 axis stabilization, Wide Dynamic Range with Canon Log, and many other features in a small and very light body. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo J. Maksoud

customer_reviews.title: Great for live-streaming
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera as an upgrade to our church livestream. When COVID hit, all we had was an old Cannon HD camcorder that was about 10 years old. I was pleasantly surprised by how much better this does with the limited light we have. Instant major upgrade in picture quality. Very happy we bought this camera.
customer_reviews.author: lane.w

customer_reviews.title: Professional camera!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this on vacation this summer - it is light that we’ve taken it on hikes in a regular back pack without adding additional weight. Long battery life and the dual slots for extra record time means no moments will be missed. The zoom levels will amaze as we were from a hundred feet away in the upper peninsula of Michigan. We are planning on using this as a additional wedding video from The balcony in a September wedding for our friends. This we tested and it did not miss a beat - video and sound quality is definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: sa

customer_reviews.title: Price point bargain
customer_reviews.text: I just recently bought this camera from a source other than Amazon. This is not to knock Amazon, it was just that it was on super-sale for functionally less than $1,350.00. I own a FDR AX53 as well, a very solid hand-held 4k device. The GX10 is a more capable device overall, though don't ask me to give up the Sony, I think both work very well. The Sony's battery life stands out compared to the Canon's (4500mAh to 2670mAh). Otherwise the Canon outpaces the Sony. I am not so sure that I would be as impressed though if I had paid the original retail price.
customer_reviews.author: Fenian

customer_reviews.title: A pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.text: We've done several projects with this camera. After getting a separate mic and the right sd cards it's worked well. My son and are noobs at this but my son has recorded his school play and we've made several home and neighborhood videos. To be fair, our previous experience has been using DSLRs. This is definitely a step up. The optical zoom is very nice. We'll be using it on future projects, It's hard to be objective with such little experience with semi-pro equipment. But this is clearly better than anything I've used before. It's definitely a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Rule

customer_reviews.title: Best camcorder ive used!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from a DSLR and its really increased the production value of my videos on youtube. amazing quality and something i see myself using for year to come. would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fabolous camcorder.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera with gorgeous video resolution and excellent Image stabilization and fantastic in low light. Custom button to tiny and hard to reach for my big fingers but great to film butterflies and flowers. Affordable price for superb image quality.
customer_reviews.author: LUIS TARIN

customer_reviews.title: Unimpessive video quality
customer_reviews.text: After buying this camera from another vendor I returned it and bought a comparable Sony from an Amazon vendor. I found the video from the Canon GX10 to be dull and not that sharp. Too bad cause it has some very nice features but bottom line is the Sony has a much better looking 4K image.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: It does record stills
customer_reviews.text: A previous reviewer said that it did not record stills, but it does. There is a button on the view screen assigned to this task, and it can be assigned to other buttons as well. Although this is primarily a video camera, it will take still images. So far, I’m finding it to be very capable of producing great images.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Considering Sony and Panasonic both have 4K models with 1-inch-ish ...
customer_reviews.text: Considering Sony and Panasonic both have 4K models with 1-inch-ish sensors priced around 1K, Canon is really lagging behind with the competitions. The competition also comes from the greatly improved video capabilities in DSLR's. My wife has been using a G10 for five years and myself uses 5D III then IV. We just don't see any Canon prosumer models that can justify an upgrade - frankly even the GX10's footage look amateurish. The only possibility for an upgrade is that if Canon ever releases a broadcast quality model at a competitive price.﻿
customer_reviews.author: Clark Y.

product_meta.title: Canon VIXIA HF G50 4K30P Camcorder, Black
product_meta.description: Style:G50 CamcorderSeeing is believing–and with 4K capabilities in the VIXIA HF G50 camcorder, you'll be seeing everything more dramatically, more intensely and more realistically. Detail and color reign supreme with the large-format CMOS Sensor, which combines with the DIGIC DV 6 Image Processor to deliver brilliant results on any screen. An advanced 20x Optical Zoom lens gives you impressive telephoto power and a wide angle of view, while the 5-axis Image Stabilization system provides the steadiness and focus you need for your productions. With 4K resolution, amazing features and a mobile-friendly design, the VIXIA HF G50 gives you stunning video quality on the go.
feature_bullets: Genuine Canon 4K-compatible 20x Optical Zoom Lens and Wide 29.3mm Angle of View
Turn your VIXIA camcorder into a high-quality webcam using its clean HDMI output

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars61 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
